text: Free spring rolls on the house she said as she sat them on the table.  Very friendly staff an I feel welcome even as a single diner.  I ordered the cashew chicken mild you have the option of getting it spicy spicy if you chose.  Well they brought out catfish instead of chicken.  I tried it wasn't bad but I would not be the person to order fish.  Another waitress noticed it was wrong an went an re-ordered the chicken for me.  I would suggest maybe pointing to the menu when you order.  Cashew chicken arrived undercooked veggies maybe they rushed it after getting the wrong order the first time. She didn't bring any plates so I could eat on this time.  Clearly she is mad because of the wrong order.  Kind of an attitude when she brought the chicken out.  Asked for a Togo box I can go home an finish cooking it.  Very disappointed in my first time here.  At home now finishing the cooking myself.

Ever since they've opened, I've been a regular here. In the past year I haven't been able to come as often because I moved to the other side of the city, but still dine occasionally and take out since my parents' house is close by. I'm writing this review because my last visit was not as pleasant. My boyfriend and I were craving thai food and since we were going to this side of town, I suggested and was excited to eat here. The Pad See Ewe is my favorite dish and I ALWAYS order it. This time the vegetables tasted burnt, noodles were overcooked, and the dish overall was a little bland. It was the very first time I've ever complained about a dish here. Since I also work in the restaurant industry, I like to avoid making employees feel uncomfortable by complaining, but I just didn't want to pay for something I wasn't going to eat. I asked the server to take the dish back in the nicest way possible. Then the owner comes out a couple minutes later saying they tasted it in the back and there's nothing wrong with the dish. We explained we're regulars and it usually tastes amazing and it wasn't the same this time, but she went on to say there's nothing wrong with the dish (basically called us liars) and told us if we don't like it, not to order it next time.. The worst part was when I told her I was a regular, she said she recognizes me but still decided to treat us the way she did. This experience was so disappointing only because I used to love coming here and I actually admired the owner because she was always so nice and hardworking. I decided to give 3 stars because I figured it wouldn't be fair to give them just 1 since I've enjoyed so much of their food until now. Their food is delicious (most of the time). I just want to warn you not to complain about the food unless you're ready to be treated like a criminal. I really hope that they change the way they handle complaints.

This is my second favorite Thai Restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything on the menu is so good that you can close your eyes and point, and you cannot go wrong. If you enjoy the traditional Thai dishes done right, then this is the place for you! The staff is fun, friendly and so attentive. I always look forward to coming back here!

Very much just a small great place to eat.  Everything I've had here is great and I try new things all the time.  My wife loves the Pad Se Ew with extra chinese broccolli  and the vegetable rolls.  The Tom Kha Kai is the creamiest that you'll ever find, Red Curry, Spicy Beef Salad, Silver Noodle Salad, Rad Na, Papaya Salad, Thai Beef Jerky, Curry Fried Rice, Seafood and Fish Dishes, they are all awesome.  If you don't mind the humble surroundings and just want great Thai food be sure to try it out when you are on the East side.

Checked out the FREE delivery and very impressed. The food arrived hot and delicious. The appetizer combo was delicious and was the items were crispy.  Combination fried rice was full of meat and shrimp and egg and goodness. I tried the vegetable tom kha and was very pleased. Yes, we will order again.

This used to be my best place.  Something has changed and not for the better.  Last time I ordered from here someone put a ton of tumeric in white rice with some obvious frozen peas and carrots and few pieces of meat, tried to pass that off like it was fried rice.  

But this time, I won't order until things change.  The Pad Thai is a cheap imitation with a few sprinkles of pepper flakes.  The shrimp is so over cooked it's gross.  The wontons were not cooked right and the mystery meat in the middle is still pink.  Used to be able to choose what went inside.  The only saving grace was the orange chicken sauce.  Very slightly sweet and a small tang.  Otherwise the chicken was dry and tasted like it was microwaved.  The BBQ shrimp were not BBQ'd at all.  The shrimp was very greasy but not under cooked. Guess why? Because in the ordering comments I asked them not to over cook the shrimp.  Go figure.

Not sure what happened to this place: new management, short cuts, unhappy cooks or staff members, or just being cheap with ingredients.  Whatever the problem is it is coming out in the food.  Very poor quality for what "used" to be a great place for Thai food.

Very satisfying place to be at . Food is very good . The pad Thai is one of the best I've ever had . Service is great and clean place to eat. Definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone . Thai cuisine rocks

My husband and i absolutely love this place! We have ordered quite a few items and have always been happy-we have also acquired some favorites like their fried rice-orange chicken and any appetizer! Their food is always hot and fresh when we get it (we tend to order delivery) the staff is super friendly and the food is never greasy and portions are plentiful-we always have leftovers and the food re-heats great! No 'food coma' either lol. Highly recommend!

Decent. .not the greatest thai food.  Ordered coconut soup on line.. they gave me something else?! Okay..?! .
Check your order before you leave.

I have been ordering from this restaurant for well over 10 years, and the food is very good! The people who work there are very nice and always try to make sure you are satisfied. I would highly recommend them, but if you order online, don't use Eat24, just call the restaurant yourself and order on the phone.

Food was great! Taste was on point . Delivery was maybe 10 min late but no big deal. I was still amazed that they had delivery as an option in the east side of town. Definitely ordering in again. You guys made my lazy Sunday :) 

Crab rangoons were soooo good. !!
Medium spicy has a nice kick to it I wonder what hot is like. Every order was good size sharable portions.

Entrees were very good, but the soup and egg roll were at least a day old. I'm sure it's a great place when there are actual customers, but the lack of patronage seems to have made them a little lazy.
My coworkers and I love this place. We would recommend it to anyone, and everything we try  is great. Why are the egg rolls sooooo good? :)
My friend introduced me to this gem in the east side, boy am I glad he did. Great spot for lunch deals and every lunch special comes with soup and egg rolls. Definitely a must try place

We loved our meal and portions are so large we have lots left over to enjoy tomorrow.  To start with, we ordered delivery and it was so easy and fast.
The free spring rolls that came with the order were hot crispy and delicious.  
Then we had the war wonton soup piping hot and chock full of all the tasty chicken shrimp and veggies.  The wontons were really meaty filled and very tasty tender seasoned real good.  The crab Rangoon were huge and stuffed full of crab like no others I have ever had.  really rich and I could only eat one, they are substantial. 
my entree was the Green curry chicken and it was exceptional.  Reflect amount of heat in the curry sauce, veggies tasted fresh picked and it was loaded to the hilt with tender chicken.  
Moms entree was chicken moo goo gai pan 
and she said it was tasty.  
The rice was fresh and we had plenty. 
Glad to have this authentic Thai nearby that delivers.  
I recommend!  Price is right considering huge portions, fresh taste fast delivery.

This place is really good.  Everything was so flavorful and cooked perfectly.  Ordered the yellow curry vegetarian and the spring rolls... Great prices and even better food. Showed up on time with everything i needed, plenty of sauce, napkins, plastic ware....  I'll be ordering again soon.....

If you haven't been here you are missing out on some serious flavor. The food cooked here is amazing!! And the price is really affordable compared to other places. Feeling lazy? Thy got free delivery! Lunch specials are great don't just take my word for it stop by and have at it
One of the best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas! Really good service! Cheap to dine in! And will definitely be back! Shrimp chow main, tried the soup, had Spicy mint beef! Everything was Bomb!

The first time I went there they had the cutest little lady who knew my fiance well. He has been dining there for lunch for years. She was so welcoming. She even gave us free won-tons and soup as we waited for our food. The pad thai is DELISH! My favorite is the spicy mint chicken. Get ready to break a sweat but goodness it is worth it. Their Thai tea is extremely good as well. I have yet to not enjoy their food! We feel like regulars when we do go.

Stopped by last night after a long work week. My husband and I have been coming here for over 4 years, while enjoying our coconut chicken soup which was , as always, spiced just right and nice and hot, I was trying to recall, how and when did I discover this palate-pleasing place. I finally figured I have been coming here for over 10 years, my family has eaten here with me, my friends and now my husband, the secret to this place: Food is always better than the last time. It never disappoints and for the price, really? I have grown close to some of the people that work there, and they make it a point to always say hello and come out and greet us.The panang is by far really hard to beat, the mint pork.....finger-licking-good, and of course I can not eat here without the chicken pad thai.....I could go on for days.
The music, the people and of course the quality of the food, all make it a favorite for us.
This place is great! The service is amazing. The seafood soup is so delicious. The music is fun. I am sure I will come back very soon.

Might get a higher rating for their regular meals, but the lunch special left much to be desired. Free egg rolls a plus, but the free soup was super salty! We were looking for a Thai experience. The chicken with vegetables just tasted like Chinese take out and although still edible, the curry was probably one of the weakest I've ever eaten. Good deal if you want cheap Chinese lunch. Go somewhere else if you want good Thai food. Service was great. The ladies were really nice.

Great place to eat! Lovely little mom and pop place. The owner always recognizes you and remembers your order. They've got large portions at great prices. During the week they've got incredible lunch specials along with unlimited spring egg rolls. I always get either their Pad Thai Chicken or Pad See Ew Chicken, and it's amazing.

The service was excellent,  and the food was brought out quickly.  We ordered fried rice, pad see eaw, dumplings,  and ragoons.  The ragoons were cooked to perfection but the filling was 95% crab\5% cream cheese,  and the pad see eaw was a little bland.  The fried rice and dumplings were excellent.   Portions were a great size as well.

This place is great! I got lost trying to find it but so glad I didn't give up. Their Pad Thai is a bit more expensive than what I'm used to, but totally worth it. The staff is so friendly and best of all...they deliver!

Well we ordered from an online company and the order was confirmed. An hour later I called no one answered. I emailed the online company who I ordered from and they too did not get ahold of them. My order had to be cancelled because nobody answered the phone. Got my money back and for my inconvenience I was awarded $15 for my next order online. 
I still craved Thai food and ordered from another place. This place answers their phone and delivered my food pretty much on time. 
BEWARE IF YOU ORDER ONLINE, YOU MIGHT GO HUNGRY IF THIS PLACE DECIDES NOT TO ANSWER THE PHONE EVEN IF THEY ACCEPT YOUR ORDER ONLINE!!!
Very friendly family owned restaurant .. food is excellent.. love the complimentary egg rolls , rangoons are to die for
Get the Panang Curry Chicken, it'll change your life! Place is very clean, the service is very good and the food is exceptional.

When it is a late night dinner, both my husband and I know there is only one place we will be ordering from.  Thai Cuisine has some of the most amazing Asian food,  my favorite is the pineapple rice, and the pot stickers.  My husband likes anything really hot, and their chicken wings.  You must try the place if you haven't already.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it. 

 Note*  Do not order lunch, it came cold, and without the soup they advertise.  The lunch combo's tasted like it came from  an all you can eat buffet !  LUNCH NEVER AGAIN RIP OFF AFTER THIS IT WILL BE AWHILE BEFORE I RETURN FOR DINNER!
This is my favorite Thai restaurant. I love their chicken fried rice. Me and my family have been coming here for the last 5 - 7 years. The owner always greets us and make us feel like we're at home.
Just want to say "Yum! Yum!", & So Far -- So good!

Wonderful restaurant. Great food. 

My family and I went along with my 14 month old daughter. They had no problem making a special meal just for my daughter because she can't have adult food yet. 

When the adult food came out it was delicious! I will definitely go again!

My wife and I were visiting Las Vegas for our 25th anniversary and had a serious Thai food craving.  We arrived at 10:50 and on a Tuesday and were the first customers there (Lot's of people started filing in about 15 minutes later).

You have probably read how friendly the staff is and I concur.  The staff are actually from Thailand where I have vacationed and dwell the friendliest people on the planet!  Our server greeted us with a smile and asked us to choose our desired "heat" level on a scale of 1 to 10.  My wife who can handle spicy food chose 5 and she would only allow me to choose 4.

I ordered the garlic beef and was utterly pleased with the flavor.  It was just so delicious and satisfying with a nice portion of food.  I had mine with the fried rice after enjoying the delicious soup of lemongrass, tomatoes and lean chicken.  

My wife ordered the chicken curry which was so coconut rich and authentic.  Her heat level of 5 would have been at my max level of enjoyable "heat".  We both said that if this was a 5 GOD help anyone who chose a 10 level.

Wonderful experience.  The price was phenomenal...$7 for the lunch special.  I wish it was closer since we are staying at the MGM Grand Signature.  We just happened to be visiting the Air Force base.

Spicy shrimp soup seafood soup , yellow curry rice crab rice, crab ragoons and spring rolls are wonderful.  Did not like Mongolian beef or szechwuan chicken which are usually my fave at other places. Great staff very friendly service oriented.  This is a Family owned restaurant. They always remember my fiance and I.

This place is a mixture of Chinese & Thai food.

It's quiet and service was good.

We tried a bit of everything, sorry no pictures too hungry to stop and snap a picture of the spread.

We ordered the Tofu Pad Thai, Chicken Penang Curry, papaya salad, Shrimp Chow Mein, Shrimp Fried Rice, Pork Noodle Soup, Chinese Broccoli w/ Crispy pork and Fried Tilapia.

The Crispy pork gets soggy w/ the sauce they add to the dish.  Maybe recommend less sauce or pork on the side to keep it Crispy. 

The Fried Tilapia is served w/ the sauce on the side. 

The wait staff came by a few times to make sure we had everything and to refill our drinks.
 
Will definitely come to this spot again when we're in town visiting family.

This is the best asian food place I have tried in Las Vegas. I'm a 28 year resident in the Las Vegas area and have seen many places come and go. Their shrimp fried rice is especially delicious. Love, love, love this place and it's super friendly staff.

**UPDATE** 
This place went to shit. Must be new management. The prices went up and the quality went down. A slap in the face for somebody who has been coming here since... it's been so many years I don't even know anymore. At least 15 years. ByeBye Thai Cuisine restaurant. It was good while it lasted.

I have been going here for almost five years. The food is great. I always get the tum yum, perfect balance in the taste. You get to pick the levels of spiciness. The chow main is ten times better than Panda's. Service is nothing special but always nice staff.

This place is to die for...way better then those places in Chinatown...the service is great I think it's ran by a family not sure but they give you attention when needed and let you enjoy your meal

I had the Spicy Beef Salad, let me tell you it was beyond delicious that I ordered another one to go to have for lunch the next daytime portion size is perfect and the price is not bad at all...to bad I live on the west side of Las Vegas or else I would be here once or twice a wk...will make it a mission to stop by whenever I am on the east side of town! Highly recommended!!!

Let me start by saying that I had their weekday buffet lunch about eight years ago and I wasn't impressed.  Either they shot the chef at that time, or they decided to start serving authentic Thai food, I don't know.  Either way, they deliver seriously good Thai food through eat24hours.com.  I think I've mentioned before that I spend quite a bit of time in Thailand, and I really love Thai food; HOT Thai food; AUTHENTIC Thai food.  This time, we ordered Pahd See Ew Gai (chicken noodles), Khao Pahd Gai (chicken fried rice), red chicken curry, and papaya salad with sticky rice.  Foodgasm!  The fried rice and noodles are going to be lunch next week, the rest will be gone by tomorrow.

If you live on the east side and are too lazy/tired/drunk to get to Pon Ocha Soup, get on eat24hours.com and order from this place.

My family has been going here since I was little, the owner is very friendly. The place is always clean if you go for lunch it's free soup and egg rolls, the lunch specials are portion appropriately with your choice of white or fried rice and I think noodles? Haven't gotten anything like that in a while I always get the curry it's just like my grandma's you get to choose your spice level 1-10 which are true to spice lol. I also get the Thai coffee which is something I can't find everywhere. I highly recommend this place if you want some good Thai food at a good price with personable people

Tried ordering on eat24 and it would not take my order because I was 5.5 miles away. I called the restaurant to check if they would make an exception and they said they would. I was quoted a 45 min delivery time and they showed up in less than 30 mins! I was impressed. They gave me complimentary egg rolls which were a bit cold but they were good. Ordered the pad Thai with shrimp and the chicken panang both mild spicy level. Let me tell you they were perfectly spiced! Food arrived hot and delicious. They even brought me ice for my can soda! They have a new customer for sure !

Thai cuisine is within easy access to me, so I order from there a lot, at least once or twice a month. I've always had admiration for them because they've been in the neighborhood for a long time, outliving lots of other businesses in the area.

When ordering for takeout, my meal is always ready when I arrive to pick it up and staff is always very friendly. The food is awesome and so flavorful and part of the reason why I stay a loyal customer.

However, the one time I decided to dine in, I sat waiting for nearly 40 minutes before ultimately walking out. They put priority on their takeout orders and it kind of shows. Plus, last time I ordered from there, they got my order wrong. I always order yellow curry, but they have me red instead.

I definitely recommend this place strictly for the food or unless you have incredible patience. There's a reason why they've stuck around for so long.
Went here because we where looking for Peking duck, we got so much more than that and it was all worth it, it was a little expensive but worth every dollar

Disappointing.
Let me start by saying that I read several reviews before deciding to order delivery tonight and got my hopes up. The food was so bland and sweet that I couldn't even eat it. Garlic pepper chicken had no heat and tastes like cardboard. Pad Thai had sugary aftertaste that was unbearable. The free egg rolls were over-cooked and wraps were crumbling. Lastly, the dumplings had fat, bone, and grissle in them.

My wife loves this place and has ordered takeout from here many times. I wanted to take her somewhere I know she liked so we decided on eating in here on this visit.

Like any normal visit we were sat promptly and a waitress took our order and gave us our drinks. They started us off with veggie rolls which were alright. They weren't particularly great but it was a free start so it's hard to complain. 

And so we waited for our order. And waited. And waited. And finally over 40 (!) minutes after we had ordered a simple chicken curry I decided this was too long of a wait. After asking the front counter about the long wait and the status of our order and only getting useless shrugs in response, we walked out.

Absolutely ridiculous how long we waited and terrible service to top it off. I guess the wife can choose to still get takeout from here if she wants but any business that values their customers so little does not strike me as a place that is worth your time or money. Specially with how many great options for Thai food there are in the area.

DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!!!

I don't know how/why some of these people gave them a decent review?

This place is Terrible, I literally had to throw the food away.

I'm not exaggerating - the food is awful and overpriced!

I've eaten at 100s do Asian food spots around the worlds and this was a straight rip-off!

STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!

I come here often and I love it. For some reason today they were cheap on the rice, but the yellow curry never fails it's perfect. At some Thai tea to top it off and you have a perfect mix. I recommend this place to anyone you wants great Thai food for a reasonable price.

I want to give this place three and a half stars.  Half an extra star because of how well they handled a complete dirt bag when I was in there.  He refused to pay any more of his bill than ten dollars, and he was very adamant about it as he left.  There was no reason for that.  They were very dignified in how they dealt with him.  
As for the place itself, I give it one star for service.  They were very prompt and attentive.  I give it one star for price and quantity, as the lunch was an entr√©e, soup and egg roll appetizer, all for $6.95.  I also give it one star for the taste.  The soup was very light and the kefir lime leaves made it very bright and refreshing.  The eggroll was not very palatable, but if I ate sauces I may have enjoyed it more.  My friend had the orange chicken, which he loved.  The breading was not too thick, nor was the sauce.  I'd say that and the soup were the best things we had there.  It also wasn't too sweet.  My pahd thai was good, but a little heavy on the sauce.  I wasn't able to finish it all, but it also came with a very light fried rice that was good. 
If you are looking for an inexpensive place to do a quick thai lunch in this area, I would say this place is worth a try.
Food has good flavor. But service is very slow. Decor ia rather dated. Close to Nellis Air force base. Price reasonable.
this place is surprisingly good. lots of vegetarian options. great prices. good service. worth a  trip to the Hood.

Spicy chili mint combination fried rice ... Wow!
Pa Nang chicken .... Double wow!
I've eaten here a couple times. Very friendly staff and great food.

Me and a friend came across this place on yelp and decided to check it out. Upon entering your greeted by such friendly people. The service was prompt and very attentive. We ordered Penang curry and orange chicken. It was delicious! We were very surprised being that it is on a not so fancied side of town. This place is a must try if you are in the area! We are definitely fans and will become regulars. Later in the week I ordered delivery and on the phone the lady was so sweet! The people that run this restaurant are just the most warm people ever. Oh! And the the free egg rolls are a plus too!
Favorite thai food place on the east side. Food is always delicious. Delivery is definitely worth the wait!

We've lived at the base of Sunrise Mtn for nearly 3 years, but when we wanted Thai we would scurry back to Henderson.  One day while we were out and about, we were hungry and decided to give Thai Cuisine a shot and WOW!  Their Thai food is great!!  So much for my illogical snotty attitude...but I digress.  We shared chicken satay and red curry, and both were fab to the extreme.  We sent some friends to try Thai Cuisine and they agreed that Thai Cuisine can stand up to the other good Thai restaurants in town.  Ambience is okay, a bit brightly lit at night, and they don't serve beer (rats), but all in all this is solid Thai food.

Really good Thai food especially for the price, remember when you see those 3-4 star reviews to check that person's history. Food snobs are hilarious with the stuff they nitpick about. For $8 the chicken pad thai is awesome, that's the same price as McDonalds for REAL fresh cooked food. The staff is also awesome I've been there several times and they seem like a very nice family. I cook Thai food at home and eat it a lot and this place is a great go to for a quick lunch or an easy dinner.

We ordered here for two day straight. We had the pad Thai which was not good. Lack of flavor and it seemed dry. The yellow curry medium was amazing on the other hand. The second day, we ordered pad see eaw (spelling) and it had a lot of meat. The beef was tender and had a lot of flavor. The vegetables in the noodles was cooked perfectly as well. Then, we also got yellow curry again medium. This time around it was way too spicy for our taste and killed the curry. Food came in 20-30 mins and it was boiling hot still which was awesome.
They always remember me and my boyfriend and the the owner always makes it to our table to welcome us back and have a sort conversation.  Food is always consistent and delicious.

!!!!!FREE SPRING ROLLS!!!!

This is literally my first review ever. I always read reviews but I'm too lazy to write em but whatever I will get strait to the point because this place deserves this review.

1. Lady on phone was nice as fk 
2. Delivery Man was nice as fk and actually talked to me for a minute. I'm an introvert(kind person but almost anti social), that being said it still didn't annoy me. 
3. Price was good, food wasn't nasty looking smelly and didn't taste rubbery 
4. I ordered fried rice and garlic chicken.. Both were good and I got a free side of white rice and 4 free spring rolls. Yea.. 4 free spring rolls lady and gentlemen oh yea and they charge .50 for can of sodas 
5.  And they weren't stingy with the sauce 

For what this place is.. It's the best local bang for your buck! 

China Kitchen is good too but this place is an overal winner but China kitchen offers fried chicken wings 

Hong Kong kitchen(or something like that) I never tried because their reviews were terrible.

I always order delivery from this place i have yet to go to the actual location but i love to order from here i generally purchase there egg rolls every time i order their delivery. The orange chicken isnt to bad. They usually come way before it says its supposed to get here which is great i will make it a habit to order from here often

Walked in with a hankering for Thai tea boba & maybe food. But I definitely changed my mind on the food when I walked in. It was dingy looking & the pics of the food didn't look very appetizing. 

Anyway I order the Thai tea w/boba & the boba looked very old & disgusting. I tried it anyway. The boba's texture was the WORST I have ever tasted or felt. It was falling apart & really slimy. I took it back & the staff acknowledged that I was given old boba! WTF?! They offered me new boba & apologized. Why would you knowingly serve something that should have been thrown away weeks ago?! Anyway, they were nice about it but BEWARE of their entire menu. I wouldn't be surprised to see them on an episode of dirty dining.

A surpringly good, authentic Thai restaurant, despite the advertisement of Chinese, Thai Cuisine was a delight.  I had the yellow curry, pad see ewe, egg rolls, and Thai iced tea.  The Thai iced tea was sweet, but not too sweet.  The pad see ewe we had was with chicken, and the meat was plentiful.  The flavor was very good, and the Chinese broccoli was fresh and tasty.  Even the noodles were tasty, and no grease!  

The yellow chicken curry surprised me the most.  It was styled just the way I like it, similar to the (old) Thai Grill: soupy, but flavorful.  I was quite delighted to find another Thai restaurant that makes curry this way instead of the usual Indian style.  The curry wasn't as flavorful as the (old) Thai Grill, but it was definitely good!

I recommend this Thai restaurant for the Thai dishes.  I haven't tried the Chinese dishes, and I don't plan to, but chances are that they are tasty as well.  I will be coming here often since it is close to my work!

My wife and I came to this restaurant due to having the craves for pad Thai for the night. We got there before 9pm Saturday night.  We were welcomed with 4 egg rolls and sauce along with our menus. The waiter was super quick.  We ordered the shrimp fried rice, pad Thai noodles chicken, and green chicken curry.  The waiter asked us what spicy level we wanted from 1-10, 10 being ultra spicy and 1 being mild. Wife chose 2 for the spice level which was the right choice because overtime the dish became spicy.  The meal came to us around 10-15 minutes.  The fried rice was awesome and delicious.  I haven't that good of fried rice in awhile.  Of course the pad Thai noodle was delicious as well and I would come back to this restaurant again!  They also deliver too so call them up if you can't make it to their place.  Lastly, we were also given banana rolls as a special for the week.

This place has really delicious authentic Thai food.  My favorite from them is the Curry Fried Rice.  I haven't found any other restaurant that has made it that way.  What's also good is the Seafood sour soup.  It comes with a plentiful of shrimp, scallops, squid, and octopus.  Delicious in flavor and broth.

I don't quite like the Pad Thai though, to me it has kind of a sweet taste with just isn't accord with me.  I prefer the Pad Thai from Pin Kaow, which is separate when you get the Pad Thai you put the bean sprouts, peanuts, and dressing in it.  That's what I'm more used to when I had it in Viet Nam.

Honestly was super cheap! LOVE chicken mint chili & crab things. Not a big fan of there orange chicken but it's a great price for deliver! $16 feed me and my boyfriend who eats a ton! 16 dollars got me a bunch of white rice, lunch special( feeds two)  of spicy chili mint chicken which more fried rice! Carb Rangoon & two cans of soda FOR $16.75 like with free delivery. Love this place. But I hate the Mexican lady who took my order. She didn't know I spoke Spanish and she was telling the other guy how she can't understand me and was being rude to me because she didn't know English. NOT MY FAULT.
Always ordering delivery from this place. Great food at a great cost. The combination fried rice, spicy chicken soup, and  wontons are delicious. Would recommend this place. Service is great!

They get two stars for reheated leftovers, and egg rolls that had a decent flavor.

I guess I'm spoiled, because I'm used to authentic Thai Food, fresh out of the kitchen. I tried their, chicken pad thai, (my go to) and it was brutally obvious that the chicken had been reheated. I'm sorry, but if they are going to serve previously cooked food, they need to come down on the price. I don't like leftovers at home, let alone leftovers I have to pay for.

Enjoyed the Kuay Jub, a special noodle soup dish not found at too many Thai restaurants. It had authentic ingredients that the dish should have. The taste was spot on and the portion was large. I've also had the pad see ew on many occasions and it never disappoints.

Living on the East side of Las Vegas, we are limited on good places to eat. Thai Cuisine is a place I've been going to for years. Thai food is probably one of my favorite type of foods to eat, so I've tried many places in the valley. This place rates right in the middle. 

The food is good enough to crave but not great enough to be my number one choice. Of course if I don't want to drive far and I have a craving, I don't really have much of a choice. 

The Thai Beef salad here is delicious. Just the perfect amount of lettuce and spices. I always cry about how Thai places do not like to put a lot of veggies in their Thai Beef Salad. They think a lot of beef is what people want. But not everyone. I love my veggies! 

Last visit we had ordered Spicy Seafood Soup. One of my favorites dishes to order. It comes out in a bowl on fire. Soup is sour with a great kick to it. Large variety of seafood inside, We also ordered Chicken Pad Thai, first time ordering it here. It was ok. Noodles were cooked well but there was a lack of flavor. It was more on the sweeter side.

Service is great. they bring out complimentary egg rolls which is appreciated. They don't accept debit/credit cards for some reason. But, they do have a ATM inside the restaurant. So be prepared to have cash if you decide to dine here.
This is a great place for Thai food and is priced great for the amount of food!  The lady that owns the place is super nice.
The food is really good, I take it to go most if the time, and a really good Thai tea as well. The place could be slightly cleaner but the kitchen looks good

I've ordered delivery from here a few times and I am NEVER disappointed.  The Mongolian Beef is DELICIOUS, the Cashew Chicken is perfect, and the Combination Fried Rice is spot on!  I love this place!

Never been to this spot and pass it frequently.  After seeing 4 stars I decided to give it a go.  Ordered Mongolian Beef, fried rice with a side of noodles and a fountain drink ($11.25).  Staff was nice and friendly, portions were good and it was very nice of them to include 4 egg rolls free of charge!  Unfortunately, the food was very basic and lacked any flavor.  The beef had good veggies mixed in but again not much flavor, rice didn't seem to be fried rice but steam rice with some egg and peas in it.  Noodles were ok.  I was thankful for the free egg rolls that came with sweet n sour which I used to flavor up my beef.  I've had better at Panda Express.  Doubt I'll be returning.

Panang curry is where it's at. This place is such a non-descript, hole in the wall, blink and you'll miss it restaurant. The area is sketchy-Bonanza and Nellis-and the inside is pretty sparse although they do have a cool raised seating area that's pretty unique. Don't let the location and the looks of it scare you away. 
Like I said at first, the panang curry is on point here. Perfectly seasoned, spiciness according to your specifications (I'm a complete wimp and opt for a 1). It's maybe the best panang curry I've had in Vegas.  You're given complimentary egg rolls here and they're not too bad. 
The service was great despite the fact that it was crowded and there was only one server. She was friendly and attentive to our needs. Short but sweet-this place is good.

I visited Thai Cuisine for lunch. I adore Thai food and wanted to continue my search to find an establishment to rival my favorite, Komol. I opted for vegetarian Pad Thai. It tasted like the Thai noodles I made from a box. The sauce was overly sweet. I much more prefer savory and spicy with a hint of sweetness. Aside from the tofu and a couple of green onions, this vegetarian dish was sorely in need of vegetables. The complimentary egg rolls were light, crisp and veggie-friendly. I remain puzzled why a noodle dish would be served with a side of rice. The Thai iced tea was creamy and sweet, just the way I like it. I had two.

It was a rainy Friday night in April... After what felt like the longest and roughest week ever... We decided to stay in, order off the app, and watch tv. After scrolling through dozens of different restaurants... We came across this places... And decided to give it a try. 

I can't really rate the service, but when I did call to confirm the order... The lady on the phone was nice and specific with the instructions we input on the modifications. Huge plus, because they paid attention. The food came in about 30 min which was awesome! The driver was super nice... And the food came packed tightly and was presentable. Remember to Take care of the driver! 

We ordered the Panang curry... Veggies only... Prepared vegan (no fish sauce). It came just as we ordered... (Spicy and full of veggies). We ordered the yellow curry fried rice no egg no butter... Again... Came just as we ordered. The order also came with complimentary egg rolls... So don't order them unless you want extra. We did on accident ( for my friend, they aren't vegan) and wound up with a ton of left overs... Which wasn't necessarily a bad thing at all! 

I would definitely recommend this place for take out or delivery. I haven't been inside so I can't really speak for dining in. We will definitely be ordering from them!
Sooo far best thai place northeast las vegas good service lovely ladys and a good atmosphere will be coming back forsure &(best of all quality food &great prices)
My go to Thai place on the east side. Family owned, awesome Tom Yum and Tom Ka! Great people and good value
I love it here the food is great the ppl are nice there the kind of ppl that remember your name the soup is good that one of the main reason I come back all the time!

I cannot believe I have passed through this place multiple times and I never had a clue it existed. Hands down one of the best Tom yum soup I've ever had. Also their Panag curry is so delicious, I order their Pad Thai and honestly I was really disappointed :( but overall I loved it. Definitely coming back.

After several years, this is still my favorite place for green curry chicken. Thai tea with boba is excellent here. It's nice and small which helps the atmosphere. Service has always been great and they remember you when you are a returning customer. I'm always happy to take people there with me and will be back again soon.

Pineapple Fried Rice
Chicken Satay
Crab Rangoons
Thai Style Chicken Wings
Eggrolls 
Glass Noodle Salad


Then you need to invite me over. :)

Came here with my boyfriend to enjoy some Thai food. I usually order delivery from Eat24, so this was my first time eating there in person. The food tasted very nice (as usual), the service was great (we were seated quickly and had refills offered as often as our glasses were empty), and didn't have to wait long for food at all. 

I ordered a Pad See Ew dish with tofu and personally loved it. Their spring rolls were also very yummy and their Thai Boba tea tasted amazing. Personally, I love eating Thai Cuisine and look forward to coming again.

P.S. I found their bathrooms extremely clean and well kept.

This is only based on my first experience.. I had the pad Thai and I personally didn't like it. It was sweet and sour with a strong vinegar smell and tasted that way as well. I did like the egg rolls and service. I will probably go again to try other items but not the pad Thai again.
Always good and has great delivery. It is my daughter's favorite Thai place. She comes home from Oklahoma and that's the first thing she wants to order or take out!

I love the pad see ew!! And complimentary spring rolls. The Thai tea here is honestly the best I've tasted and I go around to different boba shops to taste them so I think my opinion is pretty valid lol. The only flaw would have to be that I wish the food would come out a little quicker

Solid joint. I like the delivery service for the EASTCYDE. They always throw in a couple of egg rolls. FOR SHEEZIE!

Beef or chicken curry with rice always hits the spot. Thai jerky isn't bad. I can't complain about the chicken pad Thai. Their seafood soup is awesome with rice after a day of snowboarding or when you're sick.

Friendly staff. Sometimes a language barrier when on the phone. I think they were training someone "fresh off the boat" na eye mean?

One of two good Thai joints on the EASTCYDE. Thanks Thai Cuisine for the delivery service whenever I'm too lazy to leave. HIGH LIKA CHU PEOPLES!!!
The glass noodles are awesome!! I ordered Mongolian beef, beef and broccoli, and glass noodles so that I could sample the food.  I didn't care too much for the beef, but the noodles had great flavor!

This is our favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas Valley. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I love the pad thai and the Thai beef salad. My wife loves the curry.  We've never had anything that didn't taste great.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. Whoever leaves bad reviews obviously doesn't know what authentic thai food taste like . My bf, dad and myself are regulars here. We come here weekly and will continue to do so. We love the workers, service and most specially the food.

My boyfriend and I where looking for a good place to eat and he's never had any other thai foods. He can't eat meat or chicken but they had a good variety of seafood items on the menu and felt he had a good amount to choose from. Lots of shrimp and catfish. Yum! Good place for frist time thai eaters at a low price.Customer service was great, very friendly environment! Portions are pretty well sized for the price, I couldnt finish my plate though cuz it was so much. Might be a great place for a large party too since they do offer to give you extra plates for sharing. They also do carry out/delivery so they have a verity of boxes to take your food home with you no problem. I will definitely be coming back to this thai place again to try all it menu items!!
I love this place , family owned food is great service is even better , and they deliver , I always get the spicy shrimp salad it's the best

Good and friendly service. I ordered the crispy duck and it was sooo good. Not too greasy and nice and crispy. The hubby ordered beef noodle soup. Good flavor on that. Would definitely come back again. Thank you.

Ordered Tom Yum Goong soup.  Luckily the waitress asked my friend and I what level of heat we wanted.  We asked for medium and it was perfect.  Love that we could help ourselves to the egg rolls and chicken soup as well.  This was my second time there and I will be going back!  You can't beat the prices as well.

Living in Sunrise it is hard to find good food when the vast majority of your options are under Golden Arches or have a greasy value menu. I like this restaurant because it is well cooked Thai food served in an environment you actually want to sit in. As opposed to some other restaurants in the area which may have good food but I'd rather take it to go and not linger a moment longer than necessary for a pick up.
I love that they give you complimentary egg rolls with your meal in an age where nothing is free. The curries here are bomb. I have brought a couple of friends with me and this is generally the go to when we want curry. The chili mint fried rice with any meat is just a delicious flavor to experience. Their crab fried rice was a complete and utter miss for me. It was the one time I wish the portion was smaller because I did not want to finish it. This place is just a welcome spot in the food dessert that is Sunrise Mountain and it is greatly appreciated.
I come here all the time and I can honestly say their food is great! I constantly eat there, order to go, and I get it delivered. I'm so glad my mom introduced my to this place!

My husband had brought me back some delicious leftovers from this place when he was having a class on Nellis... I think it was yellow curry. (Even with good portion sizes, he sacrificed to not eat his whole meal so that I could have that taste.)

We had an errand to do on base yesterday and I was feeling Thai (like always), so he brought me last night. (This place is just over half an hour from Aliante.) My all-time favorite soup in the whole world is Tom Kah Gai, and so I deliberated over the many tasty-sounding options but went ahead and ordered it. I was worried it was only going to be regular bowl (like in the menu photo) for the 9 dollars and almost ordered a salad, too, but the server lady told me my soup came with rice so I didn't. My husband ordered the garlic and pepper beef. 

my soup came out first in one of those big hot pots, which thrilled me... so much soup! the server had given us small bowls, and I'd loaded up twice before my husband's food came out. the flavors of lime, coconut milk, bay, lemongrass, cilantro, and ginger were on point, even if my husband said the lemon was very strong. I am used to a slightly sweeter soup, but the complexity of flavors and the gently building heat were very enjoyable. (I had asked for medium to mild spice.). even with both of us having several bowls, I had an entire soup container to take home as leftovers. 

my husband was brave and had ordered off the very tasty curry menu, which I think he regretted. his beef was moist, but the garlic and spice were both rather mild, and that was after he'd asked for very spicy. there were a LOT of red pepper flakes, but I think my soup actually had more kick. 

service was deliberate and timely. 

I ordered Thai tea to-go without boboa (too full for tapioca), and it tasted the way it ought to.
This place is seriously a hidden gem. Duck and squid are delicious and pad Thai of course. I just wish they had a beer license for some Singha

I ate at the Thai cuisine resturant on 2-26-2013.  It sets on the NW corner of Nellis and Bonanza.  I  arrived during lunch and there were several people eating but there was ample seating to chose from.  The place was clean and the service was prompt. I was brought a menu immediately and ordered a lunch special (Garlic Chicken) with a spicy level of 7.  I noticed a buffet type food cart and asked what it was and without answering she motioned for me to the cart.  There were spring rolls and soup that you could help yourself to.  (I took 2 spring rolls and a bowl of what looked like soup with chicken and Thai vegtables) Both were good, the soup a little mild, but good.  I noticed that a customer had returned to the cart and took 4 or 5 spring rolls and  Not knowing if it was allowed, I returned and got 2 more spring rolls when my order arrived.  I don't have any experience with Thai food and would not know how to compare this resturant to others but the food I ordered was good and although I ordered it to be a 7 on the spicy scale, I could have ordered an 8 or possibly a 9.  I would not drive a long distance to eat at this resturant, but if I was in the area, I'd eat there again.
Love this place the employees are always friendly and the food is amazing! We come here almost every week. Love the tom ka kai and the papaya salad and my sister loves the pad thai.
Incredible lunch special. Terrific food, great service. Come eat here. I like spicy so I made mine a 7 and it was just right
First time to eat here! Dinner was delicious! Looking forward to returning for another yummy meal!
Just awesome every time I come here and I can't finish the huge portions! Get drunken noodles! Love the larb beef!

Order date from grub hub and got a huge amount of food for a great price of course the free delivery and coupons helped. The pad Thai was amazing , fried rice was plentiful , and the beef was delicious. I diffently recommend this place .

They have the best lunch specials around. 

It is a modified buffet. They have serve yourself Tom Yum soup, wontons and egg rolls. You order an entree. 

It is about $7. 

All entrees come with fried or white rice. 

I have tried everyone of the lunch specials. BUt the curry is the best. I get it spicy #5.

They make a sauce there that I have never had before. It is hot, sour, salty goodness. I have tried to find out what it is but there is a bit of a language barrier. 

The service is outstanding. Maybe it is because I go there all the time but they on the spot!
This is a great Thai Food restaurant. I recommend this place if your in the Vegas area North side. Best kept secret, a must try spot. Will be back!!!

Having eaten at plenty of authentic Thai restaurants, I can say that the food here is excellent and you won't be disappointed by stopping by.   Enjoyed the food, service and will most definitely come again

Call me crazy but I had to leave the safety of my domicile to satisfy that "ethnic" pallet of mine.  Sixty mile a hour gusting winds and I took my family out to eat.  Yes, that it food dedication (or spoiled taste buds).  No harm came to me or my family in the making of this adventure.

We initially drove past this establishment trusting our hand dandy GPS to get us there the first time.  When we finally made the place out and fight our way through the winds we came into a nicely set up, friendly restaurant.  We seated ourselves.

We decided on the lunch special menu, which included a all you can eat soup and spring rolls.  Don't be fooled by the mere commonalty of spring rolls.  Their's were excellent.  So, crispy and full of cabbage and clear noodles.  There are two dipping sauces, the usual sweet/sour and then my favorite vinegar based w/hot peppers. 

We ordered:

Red curry spice level 7 -- Hmn, not spicy...where da spice?  
Yellow curry spice level 0 --  Kids said it was a little spicy.  Us grown ups thought otherwise. 
Mint chicken spice level 5 -- Had a Chinese food flavor to it.  Not bad but not what I was craving.  Spice level was good though.  I don't like it so hot that I can't taste my food just hot enough to make me breathe through my mouth.
Pad Thai -- I'm not a big fan of Pad Thai and this was just way too sweet for me.

For curry, I'll keep going to Pan Asian.  For everything else I tried...I can' live without.

Maybe, their other menu items are the true flare to the place.  I'll just never know that.

This place is legit. I had no idea it was around, until I consulted yelp during a recent, month-long asian dining binge. So far, I've tried the duck curry(YUM!!!) and red curry w/ chicken. The duck curry wasn't overcooked, which is often the case at other places, and had just enough fat(lots but not tons, lol). Mangoes weren't in season when I visited in January :-(  The menu looks very exciting. 

I'll be back :-)

This place is so consistent ! Fast, fresh . How can I complain ? More importantly they are super nice and RESPECTFUL! Be careful though ...if you ask for spicy ...that's what you get ! Haha. Food quality & delivery on point ! Xo to this little gem !
So many yes's. Try the Green Curry, yellow curry with Tofu, &Tom Yum Veggie .

I came to Thai cuisine when I was 18 and ordered take out once. I remember it being bad and vowing to never go back because there are so many good Thai places to eat at. Fast forward 8 years and my favorite place Lao Thai kitchen a crossed the street changed owners and went down hill.

Now rewind to a couple of weeks ago I decided to give them a chance and low and behold I'm a fan 8 years later. All the good Thai food is outside of east Las Vegas but this place is good! Keep in mind just with any type of cuisine there are many variations of dishes and this place resonated with me and my child hood.

I ordered take out chicken Yellow curry, pad se ewe, and tom kha gai. It was GOOD! The medium spice was perfect. Everything was really flavorful, full of protein, and cooked well. The veggies in the curry were kind of big but it made me feel like my mom made it.

We wound up dining here for dinner a few days later and ordered the same thing and it was just as good. The plateful of veggie egg rolls that they give on the house was a nice treat. Those take time to roll and I loved that nice touch of having them on the house although they weren't particularly good. Typical casual dining mom and pop Thai food prices which means affordable. The ladies working were super nice and I just fell in love with this place. I'm glad to have found a Thai place on the east side serving up big portions of good Thai food at a fair price.

I didn't get to check out the bathrooms, but this older restaurant did look dated. It was definitely clean and that's all that matters. I read some reviews about the cleanliness so maybe I just got lucky that night as it wasn't so busy.

Yes there are better Thai restaurants like Chada and Lotus, but this place is the perfect little Thai whole in the wall.

By far the best Thai restaurant I have ever dined in. 

I always order the curry. It is my favorite dish even though I am sure the other items on their menu are just as great. They offer free spring rolls and a delicious soup made with chicken, tomato, and flavorful broth. The staff are always great, friendly; service is fast. Even Batman eats here.

Just recently did a delivery order. I placed my order through eat24. My order came 10 min after expected delivery time.  Which really isn't a big deal to me. I accidentally ordered the vegetable yellow curry (I usually get tofu) It tasted great. The problem was with the rice. It was old and very mushy. Didn't smell fresh. Might have been sitting in the cooker for awhile. I'm not sure. But it was disgusting. I hope this doesn't happen again.

i love this place. they have a whole selection for vegetarian entrees. the food is always delivered fast and they give free egg rolls that are so yummy. there is no delivery fee, YAY. the food is always delicious. I've ordered a lot of different things & its always yum.
I only only give it a three because the food was great and spicy and had nice chill music but don't change your order staff will be rude. So honestly I give the food a ten but the waiter a five.

Although they give you free eggrolls upon being seated the food here is awful!! Their Chicken Mongolian had absolutely no flavor and it almost tastes like it was about to go bad. We told the waiter and all she did was smile and blamed the sauce and offered to add more seasoning to it. Unfortunately that did not help and they offered nothing else. Very disappointed, won't be returning here again.

I love the takeout from here, but if you have a chance go for lunch during the week. They have a soup and eggroll bar that is free with your order in the restaurant. It is fantastic when you get too spicy an entree. lol. I know it is a family run business and the service is always great.

So I was delighted by the "jams" playing as soon as I entered the restaurant. Being Asian it made me feel quite at home and in my element. With that said I knew I was in for some authentic cuisine. 

We ordered the fried squid and cashew shrimp. Both weren't too bad although I will have to say I've had better Thai food elsewhere. 

But the jamzzzzz man. And all the hardcore accents from the staff, can't top that! Lol

Hidden gem. 

This place has been apart of my childhood. Nice staff, great food, and they got new menu and is great Thai place.
Ordered chicken PadThai with a vegetable spicy soup. Pad Thai lacked in flavor and was too dry. If they can't even get the flavor going, it pretty much describes their whole menu. Will no be back.

This restaurant has okay Thai food with good service, but was nothing out of this world. I shared the papaya salad, red chicken curry, and a beef vegetable dish. The papaya salad was very spicy and quite good. The red curry was just okay as the sauce was not very thick, there was no Thai basil with the dish, and it mostly had bamboo shoots with nothing else for vegetables. The beef was very bland. I tried to like it, but not even the vegetables were good. Still the prices weren't bad, the service was prompt and good. Parking was a cinch.

Quality Thai/Chinese food and great customer service at reasonable prices.  Even a BETTER value for lunch! 

So, the other night, I was in the mood for something Asian to eat for dinner.  So, I consulted YELP* once again and "Thai Cuisine" was the first restaurant in my area to pull up.  "That's exactly what I've been looking for," I thought to myself...a good Asian restaurant on the North East Side of Vegas.  I usually have to drive a distance to my other favorite spots...

Wanting to stay close, I made my way to "Thai Cuisine."  They greeted me at the door (EVERYONE DID, they're very nice that way...) and the first thing I noticed was their EXTENSIVE menu.  Apparently, they serve BOTH Thai AND Chinese food, so their selection is 120+ items.

I have to admit, when I read another person's YELP* review, I was curious about their notation that "Thai Cuisine" immediately serves your beverage choice and four COMPLIMENTARY egg rolls (nice) BEFORE they take your order.  Those same egg rolls are priced at $5.95 (for 5 pieces) on the menu, which makes this free appetizer a nice added value to anyone's meal--and a smart loss leader for "Thai Cuisine" to draw is customers back in again.  Who doesn't like egg rolls, and who doesn't like "free anything"  lol

As for the food, I thought I might choose my old standard, which is pad thai.  But this time I chose the Coconut Chicken Soup (Tom Kha Gai), which is served with a large generous bowl of jasmine rice.  And I'm glad I did!  I've eaten this dish before overseas and when I ate it again this time, it tasted better.  The base of this soup is chicken stock, coconut milk and a little lime juice, which gives it a slight sourness.  Then, the chef added plump tomato pieces, whole straw mushrooms, whole lime leaves, chopped fresh lemongrass pieces, fresh chopped cilantro leaves, a little oyster sauce and little hot sauce to taste.  What a complex range of flavors!  When Ladled over some jasmine rice, the portion is enough for three to four people (or great for leftovers).

Overall, I'm a fan of "Thai Cuisine" and will DEFINITELY return.  In MY BOOK, when quality food meets great customer service and a reasonable price, that gets high marks.

                            **READ THE FOLLOWING INTERESTING NOTE:**  
Although the restaurant closes at 10:00pm, I noticed a group of four people walking in around 9:45pm.  As many Americans believe expect restaurants will still seat them up to the posted close of business (so as not to lose the revenue), what these people didn't realize is that, for MANY Asian restaurants, the POSTED closing time is when the staff walks out the door...lol.  So, the manager offered to prepare the group something "to go," but they declined and apologized for showing up so late.  As a gracious and generous response, the manager told the group "wait a minute, I don't want you to leave hungry...let me send you home with some complimentary egg rolls."  WOW.  Nice touch.  The group was impressed and promised to return with their entire family soon.

As I finished eating my meal, at 10:00pm EXACTLY, the television set was switched off, the cook walked out the door, half of the overhead lights were cut off and my check was laid on the table.  Having traveled through Asia extensively, I've witnessed this tradition quite often.  People aren't usually permitted to "chat" over endless cups of coffee in Asia as they often are here in the U.S.A.  If our culture would only embrace this value.


                                           *** ONE LAST THOUGHT: ***   
Check out "Thai Cuisine's" lunch menu, which is offered from 10:30am to 3:00pm daily.  They offer combination specials VERY reasonable prices! (about 30% off the dinner menu prices)

I've been meaning to try this place for a long time, but finally got around to doing so today with my son.  I was surprised that they offered their lunch specials on a weekend, as many places do not.  So, that was a plus.
  We were greeted as soon as we walked in by a very friendly waitress.   She asked if we had ever been there before, and when we said "no" she gave us a short summary of the menu.  That was nice.
  The lunch specials included choice of white or fried rice, soup, and eggroll.  I ordered the red curry chicken.... spicy level 5 (medium).   The food arrived quickly and was nicely presented.  We were a little surprised that the portions were rather small, though.  But most importantly it was delicious!  It was enough to fill us up, but other Thai/Chinese restaurants have given us more.
  It's not a fancy place, but prices are reasonable, service was great, and the food tasted yummy.  We'll be back.

Lec is running an amazing family business. The food is always very delicious. My favorite is the Coconut Shrimp Soup, Thai Tea & Kung Pao Tofu :) 
p.s. Lunch special is the way to go! Free egg rolls & chicken Thai soup with an entr√©e & fried/white rice.

I've eatien at thai cuisine for over 20 years. I like the way they have improved there Decor, it is very clean and comfortable. After being seated you will be presented with complimentary egg rolls , very tasty!

You staff works hard to keep everything clean and in order with a very friendly attitude. 

Clean, comfortable good food, friendly staff. What more do you ask for? 

5 stars .
Been coming here for a couple years. The staff is extremely friendly. The food is excellent. I love the yellow curry.

I very rarely try Thai food, probably because I feel like an 62 year old person who is afraid of change but at the same time can barely work an iPhone.

But I finally got around trying Thai, and I must say that this is a pretty solid establishment.  There is a nice open feel when you enter the restaurant, my girlfriend says this is really authentic Thai food so I guess I will have to say based on that, I love Thai!  

I tried the chicken curry and some duck fried rice with yellow curry?  I'm still a Thai newb so pardon my ignorance.  Either way, it was definitely different and it was pretty adequately priced.

I want to give this place 5 stars, but I get gun shy when it comes to perfection.  I'll go to other Thai places down the road and might come back to this one to do an updated review.

I had no problem with the service, they gave us some free eggrolls as well.  Good stuff.  There was also a lady who fell over a table when she arrived in the store, looking back that probably was hysterical.

Sorry Yelpers, no real interesting stories here.  Just a solid establishment

#DontThaiMeBro
#TheGoodLife
#Level10CurryKickedMyAss

Wow, yes, a place that delivers to my house that is NOT pizza. 

Ordered Chicken Curry (yellow, medium) and a Thai Salad (pretty basic), and I got the complimentary egg rolls with the delivery order.

Curry was all right. Not the best I have had, but maybe they do it better in the store? I can't imagine it would be all that different though because it seems as though the moment I put in my order it magically appeared at my door. Yes, that fast I tell you! By the way, delivery charge was... FREE! Yes, I ordered off of Eat24 and this was the only place around me that was not charging a delivery fee.

My Thai Salad was good, lots of tomatoes and cucumbers. Very fresh and of course a nice compliment to the curry. I like to eat the salad and curry at the same time. It just seems to cleanse the palette so you don't have spicy, spicy coming at you the entire time.

The egg rolls were quite yummy. I like to dip them in the spicy chili sauce - I wish they'd given me more instead of bringing a cup of the sweeter sauce. 

Overall I loooooved my food, right in the comfort of my own living room.

We order delivery from them all the time and every single time THEY TAKE FOREVER!!! On the upside, the food always comes hot and yummy!! So I guess it makes up for the hour of wait. The delivery guys were always nice and friendly, too. So be sure to tip them good! Just don't order from them if you're super hungry. You might die from starvation.

Also, the "1-10" spiciness scale is a lie. No matter how high or low I choose. The spice still burns my tongue off. Choose 0. They will still give you a tinnie tiny bit of spice.

This was some of the tastiest Thai food I've had in LV. The chicken coconut soup was really great and served in a bowl with a small active volcano in the middle to keep it hot. They brought us a double order of egg rolls-we only ordered one. My wife had yellow curry that was great, my one complaint being that the curry broth was a little too white and had just a hint of "curry" flavor. Also there wasn't quite enough of the broth that I am used to with other places. It was more thick like a sauce. These are minor complaints about the dish as overall it was quite good. We will definitely go back! 

Ignore what your GPS says-it is on the Northwest corner of Pecos and Nellis. My GPS is nearly 10 years old though.....

Really really good !
Just moved to East Vegas, wanted a good restaurant ! Found one.  
Had:
Crab Cheese Rangoons (delish)
Chicken Satay (fabulous)
Chicken Yellow Curry (perfect taste & after taste)
Spicy Mint pork with lots of veggies, spice level 4 (sooo good)

I will definitely return ! This was a great experience & the staff was superb.
Plus they comped us wonton rolls that were sooo good.
Stay away from the lunch special and soup bar. I usually order from the menu where they prepare the food better. Get the seafood tom yum soup , and combination fried rice with Thai ice tea

July 11 2015; we came in this coconut aroma place craving for thai food taste. Since me and the hubby want to keep the carbs low, we ordered chicken satay, fried squid and tomyum soup.the chicken satay taste amazing. It has cucumber salad and peanut sauce that goes well with it. The breaded squid with sweet and sour sauce taste superb. It didn't taste oily at all. The Tomyum soup is very delicious that it will make you feel rejuvenated after you eat it. This place is worth a try if you're looking for thai food restaurant.

I'm giving this place 5 stars for fantastic chicken satay! Oh and their taro boba was a ok a bit on the sweet side though for my taste. The watermelon boba Tasted better than I thought! I will be going back! Oh brought back the satay for my family that said a party was in their mouth lol
Best Thai spot I've ate so far. Just moved to Vegas and I been here 3 times already! Great food and Service!

Called to order for delivery to get my thai fix. Guy on the phone was really friendly. Im only about a mile away from them. Delivery was fast. My food came in like 30mins. Pad thai was ok. Egg rolls has barely anything on it. :( Fried squid, drenched in oil. It sucks that my favorite thai restuarant (Arawan and Thai St. Cafe) are far from where I live. 

2 stars for the service.
1 star for food.

I love this place the pineapple fried rice is delicious we always order for delivery and our experience has been great a good amount of food excellent taste great delivery time thank you guys for providing awesome food this is my to go spot for Thai food cravings awesome

My husband and I were craving Thai food. Unfortunately, we don't have many choices in the North East side of town. We are regulars @ Archis Thai Bistro but since we did not want to drive way across town we decided to give this place a try.

I called and placed an order for take-out... we each ordered Shrimp Pad-Thai, an order of Egg Rolls, Crab Ragoons and Thai Tea. 

I rate the Shrimp Pad-Thai a 3/5 it was pretty bland- my husband enjoyed it but he is not as picky as I am
Egg Rolls 2/5 I can get better ones at Costco 
Crab Ragoons 3/5 
Thai tea 5/5!!!

Literally a hidden gem! I live in Henderson, so it's a bit of a drive, but it's always worth it. The food is above and beyond, absolutely delicious. I've had chicken, curry, seafood, and beef dishes and I've never once been let down. The seafood soup is to die for! This is an awesome little family-run business where you will not be let down!

Ordered food to go from here for our first visit. The staff was nice and kept checking on us ti see if we were ready to order (we took a while to decide). The coconut chicken soup was ok. Horribly sour if you ask me, there has to be better elsewhere. The egg rolls left me wanting better, but they were free so I cannot knock them for these. The rest of our food was great. We ordered fried rice and broccoli and beef for the people not introduced to thai food yet and they loved the flavor. 

The pork red curry we ordered was good; I would order again but will order medium spice. 

The star of the order was the Pad Thai (medium spice). Best flavored Pad Thai I have ever had, definitely good if you are introducing someone to Thai food.

The amount of food we got for the price was decent. We are still eating the leftovers!

...oh yeah almost forgot....Thai Iced Tea is cheap and good here ($2 vs normally $4)! If you have never had it, try it. You won't regret it!

Hmmmm not so much ...




I would rate it 4 or maybe 5 stars but sadly they completely got our order wrong. We asked for no meat pineapple  fried rice and somehow there is egg chicken and shrimp.  I don't mean to be rude but seriously ?  Even though it was wrong the shrimp was overly cooked and the Pad Thai noodles felt like they were just microwaved.  Maybe we happened to order on there bad day but today I am not impressed .

Pros : very fast in delivery & desserts are the best.

Some of the worst Thai food I've ever had. People need to stop claiming this place is a "hidden gem".

Orderd crab rangoon and some pad thai. The pad thai could have duck added, so I decided to try that instead of the shrimp I normally get in pad thai.

Both dishes came out at the same time, nothing wrong with that, but I went with the appetizer first. The crab rangoon was frozen throughout, no cream cheese, completely filled with imitation crab. The cherry on top being that it had a horrible taste. A combination of extremely old dirty cooking oil and a flavor of the imitation crab being old to the point of spoilage.

The pad thai, while edible, didn't have any real flavor. The duck, tasted more of pork, and was extremely dry, almost to the point of being chewy.

The food is hot garbage. I should have saved my money and went to thai places that have given me consistently awesome food for years: Weerai Thai and Lotus of Siam.

Don't come here, let my bad experience be a sacrificial warning for you.

There food is delicious!
This is a dive. 
It is not a place to go in order to dinner in and impress.

This is one of the few places where I tend to get the same dish.
Spicy chili mint chicken lunch is delicious.
Have tried the orange chicken which I did not enjoy.
Had a couple different soups which will fill you up.
I was expecting there kuay jub to be like a pho but it is definitely not. It is very earthy and flavorful with a lot of good bits and pieces.
The wor wonton is very good too.

I've eaten in the restaurant and was looking for some of the same food when I ordered!  I threw the sweet and sour pork away because it looked like it was boiled in slight pink and red food coloring, and was tasteless! the Mongolian beef was boiled in plain water and rubbery!  the only thing halfway edible was the egg roll.  the food there was great when I was in the restaurant ! soups are awesome, presentation was bar none the best with the round soup bowl with a flame in the middle, but I will never order for Home Take out there again!

Ordered  a cat fish soup that had nothing but potatoes and mushroooms.. with a few small little pieces of fish floating around. I'm very disappointed in this place.

Every single time we order something from this place something is off or not good.
Best Thai food I've ever had, customer service is amazing. We will definitely be coming back.
This place is awesome! Great prices, great food. They always remember me and set a plate of spring rolls in front of me as soon as I sit down. Great pad-thai and seafood soup.

Very good lunch specials with unlimited egg rolls and soup when you dine in. The soup is always a bit too salty for my liking but the egg rolls are excellent. The other dishes, however, can be hit or miss. Tried the non lunch special beef pad see ew, which tastes pretty much the same no matter where you go, but it was overly greasy and I did not care for it. The service is always awesome though! But it can be a bit slow as they can be short staffed.

Read the review on yelp before I decided to pop in. I mean, what kind of name is this restaurant. Thai cuisine??? Straight up thai food, nothing extra like Yai or Jasmine or Lotus. Straight up, thai cuisine. Well, their food was bomb.

Pop in for a nice little lunch snack with my lady and this place is pretty decent for the area. If you think you have to go all the way to chinatown to get a decent thai food. Think again! This place pretty bomb diggity when it comes to thai food. Love their pad thai and their free egg rolls. Did you know that you can get extra soup too if you want. You just have to get it yourself buffet style.
Average Thai food. Not the best but not the worst. If you want Thai food it is worth considering this place!

I am a fan of thai food...  Being asian i have an affinity for food from the far east...  I had the pad thai here...  I ordered it at a 7 in terms on spicyness... I have to say it was a little too strong for my tastes,, kinda killed the other flavors of the dish...  The lady that took the order was very nice... I just ordered the pad thai,, and she threw in an order of Spring Rolls which were tasty.. Not like my mom's or aunt but it was good...  I would recommend the pad thai from here.... I will eat here again for sure... Good solid food, good portions, served with a smile,,, what more could you ask for... Thank you

When I first started ordering from this place, delivery was a reasonable time. Now it takes forever. I like this place and my kids do as well. But I'm beginning to wonder if I should find a new place because of the time for delivery.

I ordered delivery food using the Grub Hub app. I had the Spicy Chili Mint Chicken lunch special and the Coconut Thai Ice Cream. Not only was the food delicious, but the delivery was early and my ice cream was perfect! I usually get terrible delivery service in my area, but Thai Cuisine was exceptional! Will definitely be ordering from here again!
We've been coming here for a while the staff is always friendly and the food is delicious. There mangolian beef is so good. Love there rice and chow mein
Love this good when I was pregnant with my daughter I ate almost every day . They are always friendly and have offers and coupons they always offer me and my family
As good as it gets. They know how to make it spicy AND flavorfull!

I'm honestly really torn on this review, I don't know if I should do 2 or 3 stars, so I'm going to go with 2. 

My husband and I have been craving good Thai food for a while, and we broke down on Saturday and ordered some from Thai Cuisine, after looking at their overall rating. 

We tried to order online, but were told that they didn't deliver to our area.  

I called, and the lady was super nice, stating that they would deliver to us.   
We ordered a Yellow curry, Panag curry, and the 10 piece egg roll appetizer.  

When the driver arrived, he wasn't carrying any change for us to give him less than a $10 tip.  That wasn't happening, so we were forced to give him a smaller tip than we had planned on, had he had change.  

So...the curries looked REALLY greasy when they arrived.  
After stirring them a bit, they were less so, but that was kind of disheartening.  

The curries were also very thin.  Almost watery.  
The yellow curry was really tasty though.  Flavorful, and there was plenty of food in the container.,

The panang, however, was a huge disappointment.  
We ordered the yellow curry at a level 3 spicy, and it was about a 3.  Spicy, but not overwhelming.  (For me...I can't do spicy.  My husband loves it.)
The panang we ordered at a level 4.  It was more like a 7.  Spicy for the sake of spicy.  No flavor.  there was more liquid in the container than beef and veggies.  SUPER disappointing.  Even my husband said it was too spicy.  

And they only sent 2 TINY containers of rice.  And I mean TINY.  When you have that much curry, with THAT much liquid/juice, I'm sorry, but you really need to send at least one big container and one small...not happy about the fact that we have to go buy rice in order to eat our leftovers.  

the egg rolls were ok.  They're the little spring rolls, not actual egg rolls, and they had a bit too much breading/wrapper...bu the veggies inside were crisp,which was nice.  

So, at this point, we aren't super impressed.  
We will probably order from here again, because its close, but we'll definitely have lower expectations.

Food it's delicious service it's awesome I have try many items in their Menu but my favorites are papaya salad on a #4 which it's not to spicy  and yellow shrimp curry #6 perfect combination and to drink THAI tea ASK for PAM she it's a great server ;)

I finally sat down in here to have a meal instead of ordering take out or having it delivered. I went on lunch time. And it was a pretty good special. You must get the egg rolls and soup yourself. The Thai Iced tea was delicious. The lunch portion of Ginger chicken was great and filling. The Ginger wasnt over powering. Kudos on the seasoning being spot on.

VERY GOOD!!!, I ordered:
Seafood tom yum (Soup)
Green chicken curry (medium)
Papaya salad (medium)
Crispy squid
Tasted great, would definitely recommend this place.

Only thing missing on the order menu is, STICKY RICE.
Can you please put it on the menu.
This is our go to place. The best pad thai I have ever had. Great prices, fast delivery, and excellent menu. This place rocks!!

Pros:
Huge Portions!
I went alone as I was craving Thai and hubby was not. The service was quick, I didnt have to wait long for my food and, as previously noted, ginormous portions! I served myself twice and still took home a full to-go box! I had the broccili chicken, so good! Oh and great Thai tea!
Cons: The waitress could have been more pleasant and the chicken was not fried, it was just boiled and I could tell.

Food's great don't get me wrong. 

Customer service is a bit awful. 

Ordered an orange chicken lunch special and tasted different, worse. I went to the restaurant and asked why it tasted bad, they said they had a new cook the day i ordered. Now their chef is back. I asked for a replacement lunch special. Declined my request. 

Eat at your own risk.

Brought a large group of students here for a field trip, they were very accommodating for a large group at the last minute. It was an easy location for us down the street from the school at bonanza and nellis.  If you aren't in this location I would not go out of my way to come here, however if you are in the area this is a good, quick and affordable place to grab thai food.
