The interior is nothing special, the typical thai interior with pictures of elephants and Buddha. The staff is very friendly and brought it's free egg rolls,  extra fried bananas for our group and just overall made us feel welcome, and taken care of. 

We  really enjoyed our experience here, some of them had food that was not so impressive,  I had the pad see ew and that was good, but not the best I ever had. In the future I would probably go somewhere else for other thai food but for pad see ew it was fine.

Very good Thai food. I enjoyed the Spicy Beef Salad, Chili Mint Noodles, and the Tom Kah Gai soup. All were very good. I don't know why there are Chinese items on the menu. We did receive free spring rolls for our table, which was nice. I do wish they had the cold, fresh spring rolls on the menu. The staff was very, very friendly and I ate here three times during a two week business trip!
Chicken Panang is always hot & fresh! Excellent sauce with great balance of spice & coconut

Ive been coming to this place over 10 years!!great staff and owner. They have always taken care of me every visit. Cool spot to check out if you're in this part of town. Thai teas, curry, pad thai!! Its all great!! They always give you free egg rolls with every order.
The food is delicious here! And they have some of the friendliest people you'll ever meet. It is definitely one of our favorites!

I've ordered from here quite a few times. The prices are very good for the amount of food that they will stuff in each box. The food always tastes great with one time being an exception. The delivery is usually very quick.
To start off, the best things about this place is the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff, and the incredibly affordable lunch special.  However, the food is nothing spectacular.

Yum this is one of my favorite Thai places on the east side! It's pretty much the only one. The food is super authentic and they always give you veggie egg rolls with whatever you order! The Pad Thai is fantastic. I suggest the Shrimp or vegetable Pad Thai. They have vegetarian options which I really enjoy! I suggest this place to anyone on the east side who wants real authentic good Thai food from a nice friendly staff!

The place is nice but was not to happy with the pad Thai but beef and broccoli was awesome orange chicken was ok not that great had them  Exchange my pad Thai and they did great customer service was happy with the place not sure if I would go again but try it
Found this place about a month ago and have ordered delivery four times already. Love the pad see ew and sweet & sour pork.
Great Thai food at a great price! Incredibly friendly service and super fast to get an order out. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone in the North Las Vegas area!

Gross! When we walked in we could sit where ever, so we picked a booth. As we walk over you notice there are tables littered with dishes, cups, food. The floor looks as if it hasn't been swept all day....get to our booth....there are egg rolls and food on the floor below us. The wall, blinds, fake plants were dusty and looked like soda was spilled on the wall. At this time I'm ready to run but the boyfriend insisted the food was soooo good and worth the gross surroundings. Then the waiting game began....wait....wait....wait....oh hello waitress. Order drinks and place our order for food at the same time. She walks off and I'm watching her she obviously became distracted with other duties. We got our drinks when we got our food. It was ok nothing spectacular and I will not be back. Took the BF to a BETTER, CLEANER Thai Spot and now he knows this place is crap.
Food is amazing! I always end up spending close to $100 with getting so much stuff. There lunch specials are amazing and the Pad-ti is the best!
The food is good, specially their Seafood Soup. They always give great customer service too.
I have been going here for years. This place is still good. They even deliver and the food shows up like it just got done (not soggy). The staff is always courteous and polite!
